sentences.english: I have bought him books and computer discos.
sentences.chinese: 我给他买的书和电脑迪斯科舞厅。

sentences.english: They bought the place they can do whatever they want to the ballroom right?
sentences.chinese: 中国人既然买了那个跳舞厅，想要干什么就能干什么。

sentences.english: A disreputable or run-down bar or nightclub.
sentences.chinese: 一种比较下贱的名声不好的夜总会或舞厅。

sentences.english: John and his crowd went into the discotheque.
sentences.chinese: 约翰及他的同伙走进了那家迪斯可舞厅。

sentences.english: Old buildings and churches stand next to stores and dance halls.
sentences.chinese: 古老的建筑，教堂与商场，舞厅并肩而立。

sentences.english: Several hundred people twirl around the ballroom dance floor.
sentences.chinese: 几百人在舞厅的舞池里旋转。

sentences.english: In the early 1900s, there was a dance hall in New Orleans called The Big Easy.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪初，新奥尔良有个舞厅叫做“自由城”。

sentences.english: I've booked the discotheque for the party.
sentences.chinese: 我为聚会安排了迪斯科舞厅。

sentences.english: It was either sleep here, or stay up all night at an after-hours dance club.
sentences.chinese: 我们要么睡车里要么在通宵舞厅里呆一个晚上。

sentences.english: I dropped across a friend at the ballroom.
sentences.chinese: 我在舞厅里偶然遇见一位朋友。

sentences.english: The band struck up for the dance, and they all went into the ball-room.
sentences.chinese: 乐队又开始演奏，让人跳舞，他们都进了舞厅。

sentences.english: With records at home, listeners imitated these lighting effects as best they could.
sentences.chinese: 家里有了唱盘，听众尽力模仿舞厅灯光效果。

sentences.english: Some dual purpose civil defence projects can be used as dancing halls.
sentences.chinese: 有防护要求的地下舞厅是平战两用的人防工程。

sentences.english: I like listening to pop music and going to discos .
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢听流行音乐，上迪斯科舞厅。

sentences.english: He started going to discotheques in his early youth.
sentences.chinese: 他少年时就开始去迪斯科舞厅。

definition: disco/night club/abbr. for 迪斯科廳|迪斯科厅
karaoke hall/singing hall (venue for concerts of popular songs)
compartment (of train, ship etc)/private room at restaurant/rented room for karaoke/hotel room rented by the hour
